info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 14 at 11:30AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A steady to heavy lake effect snow band will affect Portage... southwestern Mahoning...southwestern Geauga...eastern Cuyahoga... northeastern Stark and northeastern Summit Counties Until 1230 PM EDT.... At 1127 AM EDT, radar indicated a steady to heavy lake effect snow band extending from downtown Cleveland through Kent to near Sebring. Individual snow showers in this band are moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARDS INCLUDE... Visibility rapidly dropping to less than a quarter of a mile. Slick, snow-covered roads. Snowfall rates up to one inch per hour. Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Salem, Ravenna, Cuyahoga Falls, Euclid, Cleveland Heights, Kent, Solon, Alliance, Hudson, Twinsburg, Tallmadge, Streetsboro, Warrensville Heights, and Macedonia. Use extra caution if you must travel through this snow band. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until this snow band passes your location. && ODOT DMS 306, 307, 308, 311, 312, 317, 318, 319, 323, 324, 325, 327, 328, 329, 606, 607, and 617.
